Revolves around a family of New York cops." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1595859/","name":"Blue Bloods","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjY0NTE1ODU3OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTI4NDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Revolves around a family of New York cops.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1595859/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"thelmalee"},"dateCreated":"2013-12-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Enjoy the family dinners, and the religion (I'm not Catholic)","reviewBody":"My sister and I watch and discuss this series every Friday. We absolutely love the family dinners. So incredibly nice to see a family that all love and respect each other. Although challenges to their faith are often brought up - usually from questioning by the two sons. They make it clear that keeping faith takes work. 

I am not Catholic -- but I still very much appreciate their efforts. (Although I admit their attempts to depict other religions positively - is a hard go for them!)

I'm looking forward to what script changes may be made - with the appointment of Bratton, our new police commissioner. 

(St. Vincent's Hospital is still open in this drama - ah, if only it were so.)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":34487,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2010-09-24","keywords":"new york police department,family relationships,brother brother relationship,father daughter relationship,family of cops","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005531/","name":"Donnie Wahlberg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005256/","name":"Bridget Moynahan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0261678/","name":"Will Estes"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0106949/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0315236/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048735/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0121331/","name":"Mitchell Burgess"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1053841/","name":"Robin Green"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Blue Bloods: Series","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4119967769","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2YzZGNkZGMtYzFlMS00NDRhLTlkNmItMzZhZjVkNTdiMTc4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2YzZGNkZGMtYzFlMS00NDRhLTlkNmItMzZhZjVkNTdiMTc4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"First Look Trailer for Blue Bloods"}}</script><metacontent="

programme.review:
IMDb data; ttnr: 1595859, Title: Blue Bloods, --- Description: Blue Bloods: Created by Mitchell Burgess, Robin Green. With Donnie Wahlberg, Bridget Moynahan, Will Estes, Len Cariou. Revolves around a family of New York cops." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1595859/","name":"Blue Bloods","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjY0NTE1ODU3OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTI4NDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Revolves around a family of New York cops.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1595859/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"thelmalee","dateCreated":"2013-12-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Enjoy the family dinners, and the religion (I'm not Catholic)","reviewBody":"My sister and I watch and discuss this series every Friday. We absolutely love the family dinners. So incredibly nice to see a family that all love and respect each other. Although challenges to their faith are often brought up - usually from questioning by the two sons. They make it clear that keeping faith takes work. 

I am not Catholic -- but I still very much appreciate their efforts. (Although I admit their attempts to depict other religions positively - is a hard go for them!)

I'm looking forward to what script changes may be made - with the appointment of Bratton, our new police commissioner. 

(St. Vincent's Hospital is still open in this drama - ah, if only it were so.)","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":34487,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2010-09-24","keywords":"new york police department,family relationships,brother brother relationship,father daughter relationship,family of cops","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005531/","name":"Donnie Wahlberg","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005256/","name":"Bridget Moynahan","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0261678/","name":"Will Estes"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0106949/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0315236/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048735/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0121331/","name":"Mitchell Burgess","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1053841/","name":"Robin Green"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Blue Bloods: Series","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4119967769","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2YzZGNkZGMtYzFlMS00NDRhLTlkNmItMzZhZjVkNTdiMTc4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2YzZGNkZGMtYzFlMS00NDRhLTlkNmItMzZhZjVkNTdiMTc4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"First Look Trailer for Blue Bloods"</script><metacontent="

Although challenges to their faith are often brought up - usually from questioning by the two sons. They make it clear that keeping faith takes work. 

I am not Catholic -- but I still very much appreciate their efforts. (Although I admit their attempts to depict other religions positively - is a hard go for them!)

I am not Catholic -- but I still very much appreciate their efforts. (Although I admit their attempts to depict other religions positively - is a hard go for them!)

I'm looking forward to what script changes may be made - with the appointment of Bratton, our new police commissioner.

programme.desc:
Blue Bloods: Created by Mitchell Burgess, Robin Green. With Donnie Wahlberg, Bridget Moynahan, Will Estes, Len Cariou. Revolves around a family of New York cops." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1595859/","name":"Blue Bloods","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjY0NTE1ODU3OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTI4NDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Revolves around a family of New York cops.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1595859/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"thelmalee"},"dateCreated":"2013-12-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Enjoy the family dinners, and the religion (I'm not Catholic)","reviewBody":"My sister and I watch and discuss this series every Friday. We absolutely love the family dinners. So incredibly nice to see a family that all love and respect each other. Although challenges to their faith are often brought up - usually from questioning by the two sons. They make it clear that keeping faith takes work. 

I am not Catholic -- but I still very much appreciate their efforts. (Although I admit their attempts to depict other religions positively - is a hard go for them!)

I'm looking forward to what script changes may be made - with the appointment of Bratton, our new police commissioner. 

(St. Vincent's Hospital is still open in this drama - ah, if only it were so.)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":34487,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2010-09-24","keywords":"new york police department,family relationships,brother brother relationship,father daughter relationship,family of cops","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005531/","name":"Donnie Wahlberg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005256/","name":"Bridget Moynahan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0261678/","name":"Will Estes"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0106949/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0315236/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048735/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0121331/","name":"Mitchell Burgess"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1053841/","name":"Robin Green"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Blue Bloods: Series","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4119967769","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2YzZGNkZGMtYzFlMS00NDRhLTlkNmItMzZhZjVkNTdiMTc4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2YzZGNkZGMtYzFlMS00NDRhLTlkNmItMzZhZjVkNTdiMTc4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"First Look Trailer for Blue Bloods"}}</script><metacontent="

programme.review:
IMDb data; ttnr: 1595859, Title: Blue Bloods, --- Description: Blue Bloods: Created by Mitchell Burgess, Robin Green. With Donnie Wahlberg, Bridget Moynahan, Will Estes, Len Cariou. Revolves around a family of New York cops." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1595859/","name":"Blue Bloods","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjY0NTE1ODU3OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTI4NDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Revolves around a family of New York cops.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1595859/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"thelmalee","dateCreated":"2013-12-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Enjoy the family dinners, and the religion (I'm not Catholic)","reviewBody":"My sister and I watch and discuss this series every Friday. We absolutely love the family dinners. So incredibly nice to see a family that all love and respect each other. Although challenges to their faith are often brought up - usually from questioning by the two sons. They make it clear that keeping faith takes work. 

I am not Catholic -- but I still very much appreciate their efforts. (Although I admit their attempts to depict other religions positively - is a hard go for them!)

I'm looking forward to what script changes may be made - with the appointment of Bratton, our new police commissioner.

programme.review: IMDb data; ttnr: 10257404, Title: Death at the Mansion: Rebecca Zahau, --- Description: Death at the Mansion: Rebecca Zahau: With Jason Benjamin, Frederick Keeve, Molly Loch, Maki Saruwatari. That small part got stretched out for so long I lost the will to live. I did manage to watch it till the end but I can honestly say my 10-year-old would have been a better investigative supporter and probably director of this disjointed mess.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":130,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7,"genre":["Documentary","Crime"],"datePublished":"2019-06-01","keywords":"tv mini series","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2398956/","name":"Jason Benjamin","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0444858/","name":"Frederick Keeve","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6855696/","name":"Molly Loch"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0632860/"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"DEATH AT THE MANSION: REBECCA ZAHAU: Final Theories","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi741325849","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDEzNWIyOGUtNzhhNy00NDIzLWI0ODEtZGFkMTYzZTcwYzM3XkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDEzNWIyOGUtNzhhNy00NDIzLWI0ODEtZGFkMTYzZTcwYzM3XkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","description":"DEATH AT THE MANSION: REBECCA ZAHAU: Final Theories"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: La virgen de los sicarios
Matka boska morderców
La Virgen de los sicarios
programme.desc: La virgen de los sicarios: Directed by Barbet Schroeder. With Germán Jaramillo, Anderson Ballesteros, Juan David Restrepo, Manuel Busquets. The tempestuous love story between Fernando, an older man who has recently returned to his crime-ridden drug capitol hometown of Medellin, Colombia and the gun-happy 16-year-old assassin Alexis, who murders all too easily. When Alexis himself is fatally gunned down, grief-stricken Fernando hunts for his young lover's killer in the Medellin slums, but instead encounters Wilmar, who bears an uncanny resemblance to Alexis." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0250809/","name":"La virgen de los sicarios","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODgyZGY1OGYtOTRlMy00OWJhLThjYTItZTcxOTdmMDhiMWE3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjk1Njg5NTA@._V1_.jpg","description":"The tempestuous love story between Fernando, an older man who has recently returned to his crime-ridden drug capitol hometown of Medellin, Colombia and the gun-happy 16-year-old assassin Alexis, who murders all too easily. When Alexi","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0250809/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jetwimp"},"dateCreated":"2002-08-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"from a respite from dull films, see this","reviewBody":"A middle-aged Colombian writer, disgusted with life and contemptuous of religion, becomes involved sexually and romantically with teen-aged Medellin boys who kill effortlessly and with little provocation. At first appalled, he eventually grows addicted to the deaths the boys bring about, their magical ability to resolve the annoyances of everyday life, such as noisy neighbors and aggressive cab subway riders. The plot has some really astonishing surprises, and the taut nearly flawless script (in Spanish) is a treasure. The film , obviously the product of a philosophically inclined mind (Schroeder studied philosophy at the Sorbonne), is a thinking filmgoer's feast and works on many different levels. The main character's ambivalence about religion (the film's title, and the fact that the writer keeps finding himself in cathedrals) furnishes much matter for reflection. This film is not for everyone--- it is, even for these times, shocking. Those more comfortable with the blowsy and predictable product issuing from Hollywood committees should probably avoid it. But those who treasure the ability of film to explore provocative and original ideas will love it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3887,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2000-09-20","keywords":"male full frontal nudity,teenage boy,male frontal nudity,anti natalism,antinatalism","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Our Lady of the Assassins","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1634731801","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjBlOTBiYzktZmQ0My00YmI3LThlMzgtN2JhZDVlZTAzZWVkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjBlOTBiYzktZmQ0My00YmI3LThlMzgtN2JhZDVlZTAzZWVkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for this film from Barbet Schroeder"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0418554/","name":"Germán Jaramillo"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0050774/","name":"Anderson Ballesteros"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0720461/","name":"Juan David Restrepo"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0775447/","name":"Barbet Schroeder"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028557/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0052216/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0086602/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0884982/","name":"Fernando Vallejo"}],"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Niepospolita
programme.desc: Rok 1939. Pisarz Tadeusz Dołęga-Mostowicz (Patryk Szwichtenberg) podróżuje po Polsce ze swoją asystentką Dianą (Agata Różycka). Przeprowadza wywiady z ludźmi, którzy osiągnęli sukces w różnych dziedzinach. Na swojej drodze spotyka m.in. Melchiora Wańkowicza (Marek Karpowicz), Janusza Kusocińskiego, Eugeniusza Kwiatkowskiego i Hankę Ordonównę.

programme.title: After Dark, My Sweet
Po zmroku, kochanie
After Dark, My Sweet
programme.desc:
After Dark, My Sweet: Directed by James Foley. With Jason Patric, Rocky Giordani, Rachel Ward, Bruce Dern. An ex-boxer is drifting around after escaping from the mental hospital. He meets a widow who convinces him to help fix up the neglected estate her ex-husband left. Her Uncle talks them both into helping kidnap a rich boy for ransom money, and the ex-fighter must make decisions about his loyalties and what is right." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0098994/","name":"After Dark, My Sweet","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTJiZjU1MjMtMWIxMC00ZDhkLWE0NDItZGU2NGM2NDYwYmEyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjU0NTI0Nw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An ex-boxer is drifting around after escaping from the mental hospital. He meets a widow who convinces him to help fix up the neglected estate her ex-husband left. Her Uncle talks them both into helping kidnap a rich boy for ransom m","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0098994/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"bmacv"},"dateCreated":"2003-01-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"In this retelling, Jim Thompson's dark poetry doesn't survive time-travel forward","reviewBody":"In James Foley's After Dark, My Sweet, drawn from Jim Thompson's moody suspense novel, Jason Patric gives a late riff on early Brando. He plays `Kid' Collins, a `retired' boxer who spent some spells in mental institutions after killing an opponent in the ring; now he's frozen into a perpetual fighter's crouch. 

Now on the road, he drifts into a bar frequented by Rachel Ward and her unexplained Cornish accent (still a juicer, she's not quite the slatternly shrew of the book). She takes him home and stashes him in a trailer out back among the date palms. Next, up pops `Uncle' Bud (Bruce Dern), who suborns Patric into a half-baked scheme for kidnapping a rich kid. As happens with such schemes, things go awry (the kid turns out to be a diabetic, for one thing), and it falls to Patric to put matters right by a supreme act of self-sacrifice.

But the somnolent pace and elliptical plotting that worked in Thompson's telling sit uncomfortably on the screen. Even in the 1950s, the novel felt that it belonged to the conventions of a decade (or two) earlier  it's a Depression-era, or immediate post-war kind of story. Fast-forwarding it to the 1990s proved more a shock than it could sustain, a disparity exaggerated by misguided fealty to the book. 

While there's some fussy updating (the anonymous sticks of Thompson's vision become a faintly upscale desert enclave; an airport replaces the bus terminal), elements that need freshening stick out as anachronisms. For instance, the solicitous attraction felt by the 50-year-old bachelor doctor (George Dickerson) toward Patric can only be homoerotic. While Thompson, chafing under the constraints of his time, left that to be distantly inferred, there's no reason to be coy about it more than 30 years later (there's little coy about the lovemaking between Ward and Patric). To his credit, Dickerson gives the game away with his doomed looks of longing; was it Charles Laughton who remarked `They can't censor the gleam in my eye?' And the long fuse between Ward and Patric sputters on and on; the movie could only be improved by losing half an hour of downing drinks and exchanging alternating glances of hatred and lust. 

The best thing about After Dark, My Sweet is Patric's performance, even if, in keeping with the fads of the 1950s, it gives off too many whiffs of `method.' At least he gives the role his best shot. The movie's flaws, however, can't be ascribed to Thompson. Latter-day filmings of his work, like The Grifters of the same year and (especially) The Kill-Off a year before, show there's plenty of punch left in the old pulpmeister.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3451,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"1990-08-24","keywords":"widow,self sacrifice,tragedy,tragic hero,distrust","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"After Dark, My Sweet","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1572143385","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjhlYTA1YzctOThmZS00MTgwLThlMWEtNzRkYjEyYzQ1YzlmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjhlYTA1YzctOThmZS00MTgwLThlMWEtNzRkYjEyYzQ1YzlmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Extra (Clip) from Artisan"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000574/","name":"Jason Patric"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001829/","name":"Rachel Ward"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001136/","name":"Bruce Dern"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001226/","name":"James Foley"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0240889/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0860292/","name":"Jim Thompson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0714977/","name":"Robert Redlin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001226/","name":"James Foley"}],"duration":"PT1H54M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0098994, Title: After Dark, My Sweet, --- Description: After Dark, My Sweet: Directed by James Foley. With Jason Patric, Rocky Giordani, Rachel Ward, Bruce Dern. An ex-boxer is drifting around after escaping from the mental hospital. He meets a widow who convinces him to help fix up the neglected estate her ex-husband left. Her Uncle talks them both into helping kidnap a rich boy for ransom money, and the ex-fighter must make decisions about his loyalties and what is right." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0098994/","name":"After Dark, My Sweet","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTJiZjU1MjMtMWIxMC00ZDhkLWE0NDItZGU2NGM2NDYwYmEyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjU0NTI0Nw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An ex-boxer is drifting around after escaping from the mental hospital. He meets a widow who convinces him to help fix up the neglected estate her ex-husband left. Her Uncle talks them both into helping kidnap a rich boy for ransom m","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0098994/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"bmacv","dateCreated":"2003-01-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"In this retelling, Jim Thompson's dark poetry doesn't survive time-travel forward","reviewBody":"In James Foley's After Dark, My Sweet, drawn from Jim Thompson's moody suspense novel, Jason Patric gives a late riff on early Brando. He plays `Kid' Collins, a `retired' boxer who spent some spells in mental institutions after killing an opponent in the ring; now he's frozen into a perpetual fighter's crouch. 

Now on the road, he drifts into a bar frequented by Rachel Ward and her unexplained Cornish accent (still a juicer, she's not quite the slatternly shrew of the book). She takes him home and stashes him in a trailer out back among the date palms. Next, up pops `Uncle' Bud (Bruce Dern), who suborns Patric into a half-baked scheme for kidnapping a rich kid. As happens with such schemes, things go awry (the kid turns out to be a diabetic, for one thing), and it falls to Patric to put matters right by a supreme act of self-sacrifice.

But the somnolent pace and elliptical plotting that worked in Thompson's telling sit uncomfortably on the screen. Even in the 1950s, the novel felt that it belonged to the conventions of a decade (or two) earlier  it's a Depression-era, or immediate post-war kind of story. Fast-forwarding it to the 1990s proved more a shock than it could sustain, a disparity exaggerated by misguided fealty to the book. 

While there's some fussy updating (the anonymous sticks of Thompson's vision become a faintly upscale desert enclave; an airport replaces the bus terminal), elements that need freshening stick out as anachronisms. For instance, the solicitous attraction felt by the 50-year-old bachelor doctor (George Dickerson) toward Patric can only be homoerotic. While Thompson, chafing under the constraints of his time, left that to be distantly inferred, there's no reason to be coy about it more than 30 years later (there's little coy about the lovemaking between Ward and Patric). To his credit, Dickerson gives the game away with his doomed looks of longing; was it Charles Laughton who remarked `They can't censor the gleam in my eye?' And the long fuse between Ward and Patric sputters on and on; the movie could only be improved by losing half an hour of downing drinks and exchanging alternating glances of hatred and lust. 

The best thing about After Dark, My Sweet is Patric's performance, even if, in keeping with the fads of the 1950s, it gives off too many whiffs of `method.' At least he gives the role his best shot. The movie's flaws, however, can't be ascribed to Thompson. Latter-day filmings of his work, like The Grifters of the same year and (especially) The Kill-Off a year before, show there's plenty of punch left in the old pulpmeister.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3451,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"1990-08-24","keywords":"widow,self sacrifice,tragedy,tragic hero,distrust","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"After Dark, My Sweet","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1572143385","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjhlYTA1YzctOThmZS00MTgwLThlMWEtNzRkYjEyYzQ1YzlmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjhlYTA1YzctOThmZS00MTgwLThlMWEtNzRkYjEyYzQ1YzlmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Extra (Clip) from Artisan","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000574/","name":"Jason Patric","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001829/","name":"Rachel Ward","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001136/","name":"Bruce Dern"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001226/","name":"James Foley"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0240889/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0860292/","name":"Jim Thompson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0714977/","name":"Robert Redlin","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001226/","name":"James Foley"],"duration":"PT1H54M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Kokon
Kokon
programme.desc: Kokon: Directed by Leonie Krippendorff. With Lena Urzendowsky, Jella Haase, Lena Klenke, Elina Vildanova. Berlin-Kreuzberg is Nora's microcosm. Nora, the silent observer, is always tagging along: At parties, at school, at the pool, on rooftops and in apartments. Nora drifts around the monotonous housing blocks with her big sister and her friends, witnessing events that seem to cross-fade in the summer light. Girls who want to be slim and pretty, boys who say dumb things to provoke or because they are in love. Ruthless smartphone cameras and fragile teenagers. But Nora has her own way of looking at the world, and when she meets Romy, she realizes why. There is music in the air, Nora's body is changing, and caterpillars are spinning their cocoons. Realistic and taking on the protagonist's perspective, this film captures a summer of change." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10107222/","name":"Kokon","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2JkMTYxNjctNjIyZS00NDdhLThmZDUtZTAzMDhhMzk0ZGFjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjAwMTE0OTk@._V1_.jpg","description":"Berlin-Kreuzberg is Nora's microcosm. programme.title: Tamtej nocy
programme.desc: Zuzanna Szwarc (Hanna Konarowska), mama kilkuletniej dziewczynki, pracuje jako kuratorka sztuki. Pewnego wieczoru widzi napad. Dwóch mężczyzna atakuje chłopaka. Zuza nie pozostaje obojętna i stara się go obronić. Kiedy na miejsce przybywa policja, to jednak ona, nie sprawcy pobicia, zostaje aresztowana.

programme.title: Ukojenie
Super Comfort
programme.desc: 52-letnia Taina (Tiina Pirhonen) przygotowuje się na idealny weekend z rodziną, ponieważ jej syn Eetu (Paavo Kinnunen) odwiedza ją ze swoją dziewczyną. Spotkanie nie przebiega jednak zgodnie z planem. Im bardziej samotna kobieta próbuje rozbawić bliskich, tym mniej komfortowo się oni czują.

programme.title: Little Women
Kwiat szczęścia
Little Joe
programme.desc:
Little Women: Directed by Greta Gerwig. With Saoirse Ronan, Emma Watson, Florence Pugh, Eliza Scanlen. Jo March reflects back and forth on her life, telling the beloved story of the March sisters - four young women, each determined to live life on her own terms." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3281548/","name":"Little Women","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2QzYTQyYzItMzAwYi00YjZlLThjNTUtNzMyMDdkYzJiNWM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Jo March reflects back and forth on her life, telling the beloved story of the March sisters - four young women, each determined to live life on her own terms.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3281548/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"directorgod-2"},"dateCreated":"2020-01-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Entertaining. 94 version? Cannot judge which one is better","reviewBody":"Finally saw LITTLE WOMEN 2019. Didn't expected much cause I really liked 94 version by Gillian Armstrong with Winona Ryder , Gabriel Byrne , Trini Alvarado , Christian Bale and Susan Sarandon. Well, the casting was something that I cannot judge which one is better. Both are so so great. But Christian Bale 94, I liked better than Timothée Chalamet 2019 (Although he was good but didn't overcome THE Christian).

Two things really grabbed me.

1. The camera and light. The camera is keep moving even for the steady shots. They released the tripod and moved a little to adjust each actors even a small movement they make. They also use sunlight so beautifully like Pride and Prejudice. Aldo a couple of slow motions and mintage sequences are beautiful too.

2. The music. It is not like here I am listen like Hans Zimmer or Max Richter or even Cliff Martinez who would say even if the movie suck I am still here. Think that at least you've watched a great Music Video cause of my music. In this movie the music is there clearly and when it comes to really important moments, It really boost up the heart of audience. But it's more like supporting way. I felt it from the very beginning. Ok wow this guy knows OST!! Alexandre is more of a classic composer who made OST like The Danish Girl, The Tree of life, Julie & Julia and Philomena.

I cannot say this movie will win (was nominated for 6 Academy) a lot of awards from all around the world but it has beautiful beautiful acting ensenble and light, camera and music wise. Work of art.

Also the acting sometimes made my heart beat. Even the makeup is so great. Of course the director is also an actress so she knows how to deal with these stuff, right?

Last. The time. It goes back and forth from the past to present a couple of times but it was not confusing or breaking any concentration cause it was so nicely connected by editing and bridge music. (The cast y-oung and old -was the same too which didn't matter as well.) Something that was different with the 94 version.

It is an inspiring movie after all and I won't rest tonight to finish my humble feature writing for my next project.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":164531,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2019-12-25","keywords":"aspiring writer,poverty,women's rights,mother daughter relationship,based on novel","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2655304729","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2VjNGY4M2ItNDhmMS00ZTVlLWEyN2EtOWRlNGZkYzMwOTBiXkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2VjNGY4M2ItNDhmMS00ZTVlLWEyN2EtOWRlNGZkYzMwOTBiXkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg","description":"Writer-director Greta Gerwig (Lady Bird) has crafted a Little Women that draws on both the classic novel and the writings of Louisa May Alcott, and unfolds as the author’s alter ego, Jo March, reflects back and forth on her fictional life."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1519680/","name":"Saoirse Ronan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0914612/","name":"Emma Watson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6073955/","name":"Florence Pugh"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1950086/","name":"Greta Gerwig"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007127/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0532247/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1950086/","name":"Greta Gerwig"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0017301/","name":"Louisa May Alcott"}],"duration":"PT2H15M"}</script><metacontent="

Jo March reflects back and forth on her life, telling the beloved story of the March sisters - four young women, each determined to live life on her own terms." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3281548/","name":"Little Women","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2QzYTQyYzItMzAwYi00YjZlLThjNTUtNzMyMDdkYzJiNWM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Jo March reflects back and forth on her life, telling the beloved story of the March sisters - four young women, each determined to live life on her own terms.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3281548/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"directorgod-2","dateCreated":"2020-01-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Entertaining. 94 version? Cannot judge which one is better","reviewBody":"Finally saw LITTLE WOMEN 2019. Didn't expected much cause I really liked 94 version by Gillian Armstrong with Winona Ryder , Gabriel Byrne , Trini Alvarado , Christian Bale and Susan Sarandon. Well, the casting was something that I cannot judge which one is better. Both are so so great. But Christian Bale 94, I liked better than Timothée Chalamet 2019 (Although he was good but didn't overcome THE Christian).

Two things really grabbed me.

1. The camera and light. The camera is keep moving even for the steady shots. They released the tripod and moved a little to adjust each actors even a small movement they make. They also use sunlight so beautifully like Pride and Prejudice. Aldo a couple of slow motions and mintage sequences are beautiful too.

2. The music. It is not like here I am listen like Hans Zimmer or Max Richter or even Cliff Martinez who would say even if the movie suck I am still here. Think that at least you've watched a great Music Video cause of my music. In this movie the music is there clearly and when it comes to really important moments, It really boost up the heart of audience. But it's more like supporting way. I felt it from the very beginning. Ok wow this guy knows OST!! Alexandre is more of a classic composer who made OST like The Danish Girl, The Tree of life, Julie & Julia and Philomena.

I cannot say this movie will win (was nominated for 6 Academy) a lot of awards from all around the world but it has beautiful beautiful acting ensenble and light, camera and music wise. Work of art.

Also the acting sometimes made my heart beat. Even the makeup is so great. Of course the director is also an actress so she knows how to deal with these stuff, right?

Last. The time. It goes back and forth from the past to present a couple of times but it was not confusing or breaking any concentration cause it was so nicely connected by editing and bridge music. (The cast y-oung and old -was the same too which didn't matter as well.) Something that was different with the 94 version.

It is an inspiring movie after all and I won't rest tonight to finish my humble feature writing for my next project.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":164531,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8,"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2019-12-25","keywords":"aspiring writer,poverty,women's rights,mother daughter relationship,based on novel","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2655304729","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2VjNGY4M2ItNDhmMS00ZTVlLWEyN2EtOWRlNGZkYzMwOTBiXkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2VjNGY4M2ItNDhmMS00ZTVlLWEyN2EtOWRlNGZkYzMwOTBiXkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg","description":"Writer-director Greta Gerwig (Lady Bird) has crafted a Little Women that draws on both the classic novel and the writings of Louisa May Alcott, and unfolds as the author’s alter ego, Jo March, reflects back and forth on her fictional life.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1519680/","name":"Saoirse Ronan","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0914612/","name":"Emma Watson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6073955/","name":"Florence Pugh"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1950086/","name":"Greta Gerwig"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007127/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0532247/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1950086/","name":"Greta Gerwig","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0017301/","name":"Louisa May Alcott"],"duration":"PT2H15M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Code of the Freaks
Kodeks dziwolągów
Code of the Freaks
programme.desc: Code of the Freaks: Directed by Salome Chasnoff. With Lawrence Carter-Long, Candace Coleman, Mike Ervin, Mat Fraser. This documentary examines the representation of disabled people in Hollywood movies." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10411858/","name":"Code of the Freaks","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDEwMWU5ZjQtMjgyYS00M2RmLWEyYzYtMDM1ZmYzNWM3MTRjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDU4MTQ0Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"This documentary examines the representation of disabled people in Hollywood movies.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10411858/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jramirez-66906"},"dateCreated":"2021-01-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"The Most Accurate Documentary About Disability in the Movies","reviewBody":"The documentary examines the misconceptions about the portrayal of characters with disabilities in the movies from actual advocates, writers, actors and historians who have examined more than 100 years of the cinema's view on disability. I found the range of topics going from: sex and disability, race and disability, the false message of inspirational story of a disabled person, deaf character stereotypes, blind character stereotypes, blindness as a superpower, and the so-called "happy ending" or resolution to a story of a character with a disability. The so-called "happy ending" can go in two or three ways: the disabled person has to be killed or cut off from life to restore order, the disabled person is institutionalized as a way to protect themselves from the outside world, or the disabled person is cured and does not need any form of special needs or guidance in the world. It is an insightful and in-depth documentary that makes you want to re-think about how Hollywood and movie's portrayal of disabled characters in movies can not only be misleading, but also dangerous to the disabled community in general. Hollywood must not rely on the same old stories of relying on disabled people as inspirational or cliched-stereotypes of characters who are villainous or victimized or pitied. But, one day that there will be a film with actual disabled people that are not inspirational, but living their daily lives in a humorous or ironic way that makes fun of the formula. That would be my ideal film to see when it gets made and put into a screening or a theater.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":12,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"genre":["Documentary"],"datePublished":"2020-04-01","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi853852185","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzU0MWU3OWItNzRiYi00ZDNhLWE2NGUtNGU2ZjM4MDJmMGY3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzU0MWU3OWItNzRiYi00ZDNhLWE2NGUtNGU2ZjM4MDJmMGY3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Original accessible trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4526433/","name":"Lawrence Carter-Long"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm11657129/","name":"Candace Coleman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm11657130/","name":"Mike Ervin"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3435265/","name":"Salome Chasnoff"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm10730500/","name":"Susan Nussbaum"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm10730499/","name":"Alyson Patsavas"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm10730498/","name":"Carrie Sandahl"}],"duration":"PT1H8M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Cocoon
Kokon
Cocoon
programme.desc:
Cocoon: Directed by Ron Howard. With Don Ameche, Wilford Brimley, Hume Cronyn, Brian Dennehy. When a group of trespassing seniors swim in a pool containing alien cocoons, they find themselves energized with youthful vigor." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0088933/","name":"Cocoon","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzFiMWRiZTItMjViNy00ZjUzLTg1MTMtNTU4OGRlNzA2MTc2L2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a group of trespassing seniors swim in a pool containing alien cocoons, they find themselves energized with youthful vigor.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0088933/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"raymond-15"},"dateCreated":"2004-08-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Interesting and thought-provoking","reviewBody":"Made 20 years ago with some former well-known actors, this film has stood the test of time very well and delivers a very interesting and thought-provoking story about the mortality of man.

A group of people in a retirement village discover a neighbouring swimming pool which is out of bounds, but they have fun in it nevertheless. There are some strange objects lying on the bottom of the pool, but even more strange is the fact that after swimming there the old folk feel transformed and the vigor of their youth returns to their bodies. This makes for some light comedy as their hormones begin to take over.

These old people have a very serious decision to make and it is not an easy one. This is probably the best part of the film. Should they accept or decline the invitation? Having made the decision there is no turning back! We ask ourselves...what would we do placed in their circumstances? We feel very much involved. Thinking it over, isn't this proposal very much like what the Christian churches are promising us?

The final memorial church service by the sea is such a fitting ending and the little grandson David gives such a knowing smile as he raises his eyes to the sky.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":60009,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"1985-06-21","keywords":"alien,swimming pool,bare chested male,peephole,shapeshifter","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2708061721","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2EzOGMxOTEtNzNiNi00OWJkLWE4NTAtMzMyODk2MzBjMzJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2EzOGMxOTEtNzNiNi00OWJkLWE4NTAtMzMyODk2MzBjMzJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000747/","name":"Don Ameche"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000979/","name":"Wilford Brimley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002025/","name":"Hume Cronyn"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000165/","name":"Ron Howard"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019166/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142386/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0070676/","name":"Tom Benedek"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0764545/","name":"David Saperstein"}],"duration":"PT1H57M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0088933, Title: Cocoon, --- Description: Cocoon: Directed by Ron Howard. With Don Ameche, Wilford Brimley, Hume Cronyn, Brian Dennehy. When a group of trespassing seniors swim in a pool containing alien cocoons, they find themselves energized with youthful vigor." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0088933/","name":"Cocoon","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzFiMWRiZTItMjViNy00ZjUzLTg1MTMtNTU4OGRlNzA2MTc2L2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a group of trespassing seniors swim in a pool containing alien cocoons, they find themselves energized with youthful vigor.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0088933/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"raymond-15","dateCreated":"2004-08-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Interesting and thought-provoking","reviewBody":"Made 20 years ago with some former well-known actors, this film has stood the test of time very well and delivers a very interesting and thought-provoking story about the mortality of man.

A group of people in a retirement village discover a neighbouring swimming pool which is out of bounds, but they have fun in it nevertheless. There are some strange objects lying on the bottom of the pool, but even more strange is the fact that after swimming there the old folk feel transformed and the vigor of their youth returns to their bodies. This makes for some light comedy as their hormones begin to take over.

These old people have a very serious decision to make and it is not an easy one. This is probably the best part of the film. Should they accept or decline the invitation? Having made the decision there is no turning back! We ask ourselves...what would we do placed in their circumstances? We feel very much involved. Thinking it over, isn't this proposal very much like what the Christian churches are promising us?

The final memorial church service by the sea is such a fitting ending and the little grandson David gives such a knowing smile as he raises his eyes to the sky.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":60009,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"1985-06-21","keywords":"alien,swimming pool,bare chested male,peephole,shapeshifter","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2708061721","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2EzOGMxOTEtNzNiNi00OWJkLWE4NTAtMzMyODk2MzBjMzJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2EzOGMxOTEtNzNiNi00OWJkLWE4NTAtMzMyODk2MzBjMzJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000747/","name":"Don Ameche","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000979/","name":"Wilford Brimley","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002025/","name":"Hume Cronyn"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000165/","name":"Ron Howard"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019166/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142386/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0070676/","name":"Tom Benedek","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0764545/","name":"David Saperstein"],"duration":"PT1H57M"</script><metacontent="

A Catholic Priest and an English teacher get stranded in a school in Kigali during the 1994 Rwandan genocide." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0420901/","name":"Shooting Dogs","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM4NjA2MTAwNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzc0NzI0MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A Catholic Priest and an English teacher get stranded in a school in Kigali during the 1994 Rwandan genocide.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0420901/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"autobenelux"},"dateCreated":"2006-11-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"What a film!!","reviewBody":"This film is worthy of all the plaudits that one can offer. it is not a film from a large Hollywood studio and thus will not merit for any Hollywood inspired praise. Nevertheless John Hurt performance is without doubt Oscar worthy . The film is factual without being inspired by the normal heartstrings of sanitised music which usually accompanies movies such as this. It is even superior to Hotel Rwanda which again was wonderful but takes the issue even further particularly as it applies to the so called civilised UN nations. If ever there was a need for a real UN this film exemplifies it. Camera work is excellent and acting right through the cast is credible and believable without having to employ any token players from the extensive list of TV actors and the like.The Belgian Officer is so real and his frustration there for all to see. \n\nIn summary a film that everyone should see and form an opinion.There is no hard pressed "hit you in the face" moralising, but one would have to be non human not to appreciate the essence of this story. 10/10","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":11355,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","History","War"],"datePublished":"2006-03-31","keywords":"africa,rwanda,genocide,faith,school","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Beyond the Gates (2005)","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1334968601","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTZmNDk5MTYtZjgzYy00YmM0LWExYWUtY2U1M2E1NzEyY2EwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTZmNDk5MTYtZjgzYy00YmM0LWExYWUtY2U1M2E1NzEyY2EwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from IFC Films"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000457/","name":"John Hurt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0199215/","name":"Hugh Dancy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0395850/","name":"Dominique Horwitz"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001994/","name":"Michael Caton-Jones"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0139826/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0164664/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103694/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0938727/","name":"David Wolstencroft"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2017213/","name":"Richard Alwyn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0069582/","name":"David Belton"}],"duration":"PT1H55M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Riverworld
Świat rzeki
Riverworld
programme.desc: Riverworld: Directed by Kari Skogland. With Brad Johnson, Karen Holness, Emily Lloyd, Jeremy Birchall. Hale, an American astronaut dies and is reincarnated with other persons who have lived throughout all of human history and end up on a mysterious planet called 'Riverworld'. The humans are left to their own devices and create tribal fiefdoms and succumb to brutal wars and raids. A mysterious race of hooded 'beings' oversee them - sometimes intervening, but their motives are unknown. Anyone who has ever lived and died on Earth comes here rather than 'the afterlife', even an extra-terrestrial call Monat, who had the unfortunate luck of dying on Planet earth in 2039. Hale leads a revolt and joins with others on a large boat to explore this mysterious new world." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0310952/","name":"Riverworld","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQyMTQyMjg4OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjM0OTYyMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Hale, an American astronaut dies and is reincarnated with other persons who have lived throughout all of human history and end up on a mysterious planet called 'Riverworld'. programme.title: Another Day
W innym życiu
Another Life
programme.desc: Another Day: Directed by Jeffrey Reiner. With Shannen Doherty, Max Martini, Julian McMahon, Courtney Kidd. A woman's boyfriend dies in a fire after a fight over the couple's unborn child. After the woman is involved in a drowning accident a few years later, she wakes up on-shore to find that she's living two days before her boyfriend's fatal fire." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0295172/","name":"Another Day","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTcwODQ3MDQwNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTA3NzU4Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A woman's boyfriend dies in a fire after a fight over the couple's unborn child. After the woman is involved in a drowning accident a few years later, she wakes up on-shore to find that she's living two days before her boyfriend's fa","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0295172/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"skagnew"},"dateCreated":"2001-12-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Wonderful Acting","reviewBody":"I think that Shannen Doherty exhibited wonderful acting in this movie. She's always been an excellent actress - but this movie seemed to make her stretch those abilities. The movie is about her husband dying in a warehouse fire. After 5 years, through a supernatural event, she gets the chance to relive the days before her husband's death. She tries to change the past, but learns the truth about what happened that day, and that if it happened before, it's meant to happen. I got really caught up in the emotions of the movie, and I think this is a great made-for-tv movie!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":763,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"contentRating":"TV-PG","genre":["Drama","Sci-Fi","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2001-12-04","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001147/","name":"Shannen Doherty"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0242882/","name":"Max Martini"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0573037/","name":"Julian McMahon"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0718001/","name":"Jeffrey Reiner"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054762/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0020958/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0016350/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1094769/","name":"Helen Frost"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1104079/","name":"Don MacLeod"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Godfather: Part III
Naciągacze
The Grifters
programme.desc:
The Godfather: Part III: Directed by Francis Ford Coppola. With Al Pacino, Diane Keaton, Talia Shire, Andy Garcia. Follows Michael Corleone, now in his 60s, as he seeks to free his family from crime and find a suitable successor to his empire." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0099674/","name":"The Godfather: Part III","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWFlYWY2YjYtNjdhNi00MzVlLTg2MTMtMWExNzg4NmM5NmEzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDk5Mzc5MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows Michael Corleone, now in his 60s, as he seeks to free his family from crime and find a suitable successor to his empire.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0099674/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ccthemovieman-1"},"dateCreated":"2006-01-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"Unjustily Criticized","reviewBody":"I stayed away from this film for a long time, doing a dumb thing: listening to the well-known film critics.

When I finally got around to it, I was very surprised. It was a good film. Not great, not intense as the first two Godfather flicks, but definitely a lot better than advertised.

Many people said this was filled with anti-Roman Catholic propaganda, but I didn't it find that way. Yes, the "Vatican bank," whatever that is, was portrayed as not on the up-and-up, but it was a little confusing to follow, maybe too confusing to get offended! Actually, there were some positive things, religious-wise, with Al Pacino's character, who sought forgiveness for his past sins and made a few very profound statements such as, "What good is confession if it isn't followed by repentance?"

Anyway, Pacino's acting talents are the main attraction in the lower-key, more cerebral Godfather film. There isn't that much action but when it occurs, it's pretty violent. As with the other two films in the series, it's nicely photographed with a lot of nice brown tints.

Finally, director-writer Francis Ford Coppola took a lot of flak for putting his daughter in such an important role but I thought she (Sofia Coppola) was fine and - like this film - unfairly criticized.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":374624,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"1990-12-25","keywords":"opera,gangster,catholic church,violence,organized crime","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1237827865","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDYyZmQyMjMtMGQyMS00YjYwLWIxZWEtMzQ0ODNlYzFkM2YyXkEyXkFqcGdeQWRvb2xpbmhk._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDYyZmQyMjMtMGQyMS00YjYwLWIxZWEtMzQ0ODNlYzFkM2YyXkEyXkFqcGdeQWRvb2xpbmhk._V1_.jpg","description":"See the never-before-seen version of the final film, The #GodfatherCoda: The Death of Michael Corleone. Newly re-edited with restored picture and sound, experience the filmmaker’s true vision for the conclusion of the most celebrated saga in cinema history. In select theaters starting December 4."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000199/","name":"Al Pacino"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000473/","name":"Diane Keaton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000412/","name":"Andy Garcia"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000338/","name":"Francis Ford Coppola"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0035894/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0701374/","name":"Mario Puzo"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000338/","name":"Francis Ford Coppola"}],"duration":"PT2H42M"}</script><metacontent="

When I finally got around to it, I was very surprised. It was a good film. Not great, not intense as the first two Godfather flicks, but definitely a lot better than advertised.

Many people said this was filled with anti-Roman Catholic propaganda, but I didn't it find that way. Yes, the "Vatican bank," whatever that is, was portrayed as not on the up-and-up, but it was a little confusing to follow, maybe too confusing to get offended! Actually, there were some positive things, religious-wise, with Al Pacino's character, who sought forgiveness for his past sins and made a few very profound statements such as, "What good is confession if it isn't followed by repentance?"

Anyway, Pacino's acting talents are the main attraction in the lower-key, more cerebral Godfather film. There isn't that much action but when it occurs, it's pretty violent. As with the other two films in the series, it's nicely photographed with a lot of nice brown tints.

Finally, director-writer Francis Ford Coppola took a lot of flak for putting his daughter in such an important role but I thought she (Sofia Coppola) was fine and - like this film - unfairly criticized.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":374624,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"1990-12-25","keywords":"opera,gangster,catholic church,violence,organized crime","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1237827865","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDYyZmQyMjMtMGQyMS00YjYwLWIxZWEtMzQ0ODNlYzFkM2YyXkEyXkFqcGdeQWRvb2xpbmhk._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDYyZmQyMjMtMGQyMS00YjYwLWIxZWEtMzQ0ODNlYzFkM2YyXkEyXkFqcGdeQWRvb2xpbmhk._V1_.jpg","description":"See the never-before-seen version of the final film, The #GodfatherCoda: The Death of Michael Corleone. Newly re-edited with restored picture and sound, experience the filmmaker’s true vision for the conclusion of the most celebrated saga in cinema history. In select theaters starting December 4.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000199/","name":"Al Pacino","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000473/","name":"Diane Keaton","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000412/","name":"Andy Garcia"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000338/","name":"Francis Ford Coppola"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0035894/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0701374/","name":"Mario Puzo","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000338/","name":"Francis Ford Coppola"],"duration":"PT2H42M"</script><metacontent="

programme.desc:
Lavalantula: Directed by Mike Mendez. With Steve Guttenberg, Nia Peeples, Patrick Renna, Carlos Bernard. Volcanic eruptions in Los Angeles unleash a swarm of gigantic, lava-breathing tarantulas." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4060576/","name":"Lavalantula","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEzMTY5OTEzNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzgwODM2NTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Volcanic eruptions in Los Angeles unleash a swarm of gigantic, lava-breathing tarantulas.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4060576/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Prismark10"},"dateCreated":"2016-05-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"Volcanic spiders","reviewBody":"Lavalantula with Steve Guttenberg. I was fearing the worst with this SyFy channel film and surprisingly ended up enjoying it.

A cheesy B film with decent enough special effects as Guttenberg plays a down on his luck actor who finds that there are a series of tremors in LA and then a volcanic eruption that spews up giant fire breathing spiders. Guttenberg needs to get to warn his wife and teenage son. Along the way he commandeers a Hollywood tour bus, gets help from a one armed former stunt man and gets exposition from a scientist in the museum at the La Brea Tarpits.

In the meantime Guttenberg is joined by his former co stars from the Police Academy films, there are in jokes such as the Blue Oyster bar being destroyed and a rip roaring speech by Guttenberg which owes a little to Independence Day.

Fun, action packed, cheap, cheesy and even a little scary. A real improvement from the usual SyFy output.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2962,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.6},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2015-07-25","keywords":"giant spider,family man,tremor,shaker,shotgun","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Lavalantula","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4037653017","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGJlMjMwOTYtMTJmMi00NjQ3LTk0ZmQtM2I5YmEzYTU4YzFiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGJlMjMwOTYtMTJmMi00NjQ3LTk0ZmQtM2I5YmEzYTU4YzFiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Lavalantula"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000430/","name":"Steve Guttenberg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001604/","name":"Nia Peeples"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0719606/","name":"Patrick Renna"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0579079/","name":"Mike Mendez"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017447/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0282285/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1140089/","name":"Neil Elman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0579079/","name":"Mike Mendez"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4639862/","name":"Ashley O'Neil"}],"duration":"PT1H23M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Polar Opposites
Bieguny śmierci
Polar Opposites
programme.desc:
Polar Opposites: Directed by Fred Olen Ray. With Charles Shaughnessy, Tracy Nelson, Ken Barnett, Beth Grant. David Terran wrote scientific theories predicting an inevitable shift in Earth's magnetic poles. Then an Iranian underground nuclear test sets off a global phenomenon that matches David's doomsday scenario." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1172069/","name":"Polar Opposites","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTExMDg0MTQwNjReQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU3MDkyNTI2ODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"David Terran wrote scientific theories predicting an inevitable shift in Earth's magnetic poles. Then an Iranian underground nuclear test sets off a global phenomenon that matches David's doomsday scenario.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1172069/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"SciVortex"},"dateCreated":"2008-06-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Science-Fact Rocks the World","reviewBody":"If you're expecting a splashy, big-budget Hollywood disaster flick, you should stick to "The Day After Tomorrow" or "Deep Impact." "Polar Opposites" strength does NOT come from million dollar fx, or performances by academy-award-winning actors. The thing that makes this low-budget independent film so engaging is the story and the relationships that develop while the story world unravels on screen.

At its simplest, "Polar Opposites" spins a tale about a possible global disaster set in motion by a nuclear blast, and how a scientist is called upon to save the day. The scientific theories proposed by the story are chillingly accurate, and they are what hooked me initially. It's refreshing to see science-fact made understandable and yes, entertaining (the tangerine/battery visual was funny). But the film goes beyond simply laying out facts and ideas to tell the story. It puts together a group of characters that have real issues in dealing with the problem, and with each other. There is a father/son relationship (Charles Shaunessy and Clive Revill) that is touching and real, funny and even corny at times. Tracey Nelson and Kieren Hutchinson play doctors coping with the crisis, but they still have a playful side to their relationship. And the actor playing their patient, Al (Ismael Carlo), is both unsettling and tender.

In the end, the disaster unfolds like it might in any other disaster flick (although, as I mentioned, without the huge big budget fx). But the story and the characters were the ingredient that actually made the film quite enjoyable.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":536,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Drama"],"datePublished":"2008-06-06","keywords":"nuclear test,friendship,scientist,writer,earthquake","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Deadly Shift","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi887948825","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzQ4NDlhODktN2NlMy00YTY3LWE3MjItY2ZmMjkyMWUyODUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzQ4NDlhODktN2NlMy00YTY3LWE3MjItY2ZmMjkyMWUyODUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Ground Zero: The Deady Shift aka Polar Opposites"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0789478/","name":"Charles Shaughnessy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0625796/","name":"Tracy Nelson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1757373/","name":"Ken Barnett"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0676248/","name":"Fred Olen Ray"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0167713/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0563701/","name":"Paolo Mazzucato"}],"duration":"PT1H25M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc:
Sinbad and the Minotaur: Directed by Karl Zwicky. With Manu Bennett, Holly Brisley, Steven Grives, Jared Robinsen. Sinbad discovers an ivory scroll case in the desert camp of the evil sorcerer Al-Jibar, leading him to the golden head of the Colossus of Rhodes." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1577065/","name":"Sinbad and the Minotaur","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODMwMzcyNjUxNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzI3ODk1Mw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Sinbad discovers an ivory scroll case in the desert camp of the evil sorcerer Al-Jibar, leading him to the golden head of the Colossus of Rhodes.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1577065/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"torrentstorm"},"dateCreated":"2011-02-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"On stealing the golden head of the Colossus....","reviewBody":"or horns coming out of your forehead.

Aladdin's mission is basically that: find the lost treasure of Minos (the Colossus' head), and in the interim, overcome a few perils, or should I say "perils", such as an evil dark mage and his human fighter/horror necro ghoul, an island whose inhabitants turn into would-be 'minotaurians' from some kind of curse, some thugs here and there also intent on stopping him, and of course, the infamous minotaur, a CG-created enormous bull that bellows and stomps its way through a cave called a labyrinth (of course), flaming red eyes and no other grotesque features other than a hideous head and ginormous horns.

But to Aladdin, all these are just "details, details", as he often interjects during the movie. I don't ever recall thinking of Aladdin as a throw-all-caution-to-the wind guy, strutting into all kinds of 'unknown' dangers, and when entering the 'labyrinth', (careful! the minotaur!), "details, details". About half-way through the movie, just sitting there dumbly watching this, I am wondering where this is all going, or what exactly is this supposed to be. For a fairy-tale story, it falls pitifully short. For special effects, it is not that highly budgeted an adventure. For teaching some lessons or morals, nothing either. Appealing to an adult audience - not unless you've got less than half a brain. For children, some parts maybe, but it was much too violent and gory for a young audience (ripping off body parts and horns going right through and breaking off). The story was also poorly scripted and acted out, and I say this, not because it had to be a highly paid or budgeted film, but because it lacked substance and imagination.

How many movies have I seen throughout the years, seemingly uninspiring and old story-based, but made with such dedication and inspiration, you fail to notice they're old? Way back, even, in the days when, as a kid, I was mesmerized by 'Jason and the Argonauts', 'Clash of Titans', 'Sinbad the Sailor' (and there were a host of these with similar themes), many of them not big movies, but most left something, which today, sadly, is lacking in many of such. 

No need to say more, I believe. You get the picture."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1167,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3.2},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Adventure","Fantasy","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2011-05-21","keywords":"adventurer,mythology,character names as title,the minotaur character,four word title","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Sinbad and the Minotaur","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2542574617","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzgwNDk2ODgtNDY5NC00NDQ1LWE5M2YtNzAyMThhNjFlMTM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzgwNDk2ODgtNDY5NC00NDQ1LWE5M2YtNzAyMThhNjFlMTM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Sinbad and the Minotaur"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0071847/","name":"Manu Bennett"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0109863/","name":"Holly Brisley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0342708/","name":"Steven Grives"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0959052/","name":"Karl Zwicky"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0239720/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3760215/","name":"Jim Noble"}],"duration":"PT1H28M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Saltwater
Atomowy rekin
Atomic Shark
programme.desc:
Saltwater: Directed by A.B. Stone. With Rachele Brooke Smith, Jeff Fahey, David Faustino, Bobby Campo. A group of lifeguards attempt to kill an atomic shark that is terrorizing the coast of San Diego." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5899100/","name":"Saltwater","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmQwZDZmZTItM2Q3NC00ZmU1LTllMzYtZmE2ODZhNTdhYWYxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc4ODQ5NDU@._V1_.jpg","description":"A group of lifeguards attempt to kill an atomic shark that is terrorizing the coast of San Diego.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5899100/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"TheLittleSongbird"},"dateCreated":"2018-03-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"Very under-cooked toast on the coast","reviewBody":"Low budget shark films generally do not get a good reputation and one can see why. There are a few guilty pleasure ones, like the first two 'Sharknado' films while not considering them great by any stretch. Most are just painfully amateurish with very little to them to set them apart or make them different, other than the odd silly idea not well executed. 

The good news is for 'Atomic Shark' is that there are far worse shark films out there (those from SyFy and The Asylum are notorious in this regard) and at least there are redeeming values, even if not many. Something that cannot be said for too many other low-budget shark films, of the shark films seen recently 'Atomic Shark' is actually one of the least bad. The not so good news is that 'Atomic Shark' is still not a good film at all, with a lot wrong with it and the wrong elements are done poorly.

Jeff Fahey and David Faustino do conscientiously reasonable jobs with what they have. Generally, when it comes to low budget shark films the acting is surprisingly competent when it tends in most shark films to be all-round awful. 

Scenery is nice and there are times where the shark action is fun to watch.

Unfortunately, that is only sporadic. The shark effects look terrible, even for low budget, and there is not much menace, suspense or fun in the mostly under-utilised and under-characterised shark action. 

Much of 'Atomic Shark' is a mess of unintentional humour, awkward dialogue, stilted and mawkish melodrama and bland and annoying character writing (not the actors' fault, it's the writing). Complete with a story that is silly, implausible and essentially your basic more of the same generic low-budget shark film with nothing new. 

It's not just the shark effects that look cheap. Excepting the scenery, visually 'Atomic Shark' is very drab and rushed-looking. 

Overall, silly and under-cooked. Not unwatchable but easily skip-able. 3/10 Bethany Cox","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":3}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":695,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3.6},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2016-07-24","keywords":"creature feature,shark,shark feature","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2855957/","name":"Rachele Brooke Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001194/","name":"Jeff Fahey"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004910/","name":"David Faustino"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6838943/","name":"A.B. Stone"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0800303/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0243206/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8309058/","name":"Scott Foy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0975225/","name":"Griff Furst"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0811468/","name":"Jack Snyder"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="
